title: Research handbook on critical legal theory
subject: Critique du droit (Mouvement)
Droit -- Étude et enseignement
Droit -- Recherche documentaire
Critical legal studies
Law -- Philosophy

Legal research
publisher: Cheltenham, UK : Edward Elgar Publishing Limited
description: "Critical theory, characteristically linked with the politics of theoretical engagement, covers the manifold of the connections between theory and praxis. This thought-provoking Research Handbook captures the broad range of those connections as far as legal thought is concerned and retains an emphasis both on the politics of theory, and on the notion of theoretical engagement. The first part examines the question of definition and tracks the origins and development of critical legal theory along its European and North American trajectories. The second part looks at the thematic connections between the development of legal theory and other currents of critical thought such as; Feminism, Marxism, Critical Race Theory, varieties of post-modernism, as well as the various 'turns' (ethical, aesthetic, political) of critical legal theory. The third and final part explores particular fields of law, addressing the question how the field has been shaped by critical legal theory, or what critical approaches reveal about the field, with the clear focus on opportunities for social transformation."
series: Research handbooks in legal theory series$$QResearch handbooks in legal theory series
Research handbooks in legal theory.$$QResearch handbooks in legal theory.
contents: Critical theory and the law : reflections on origins, trajectories and conjunctures / Emilios Christodoulidis -- Critical legal realism in a nutshell / Dennis M. Davis and Karl Klare -- Critical legal feminisms / Rosemary Hunter -- Critical race theory / Mathias Möschel -- Queer in the law : critique and post critique / Mariano Croce -- Marxism and the political economy of law / Emilios Christodoulidis and Marco Goldoni -- Critical theory of the state / Bob Jessop -- Law and the public/private distinction / Scott Veitch -- Rhetoric, semiotics, synaesthetics / Peter Goodrich -- Law and deconstruction / Johan van der Walt -- The ethical turn in critical legal thought / Louis E. Wolcher -- Law is a stage : from aesthetics to affective aestheses / Andreas Philippopoulos-Mihalopoulos -- The responsibilities of the critic : law, politics and the Critical Legal Conference / Costas Douzinas -- Law in the mirror of critique : a report to an academy / Kyle McGee -- Property law / Paddy Ireland -- Ideology and argument construction in contract law / Richard Michael Fischl -- Critical copyright law and the politics of "IP" / Carys J. Craig -- A different kind of 'end of history' for corporate law / Lilian Moncrieff -- Critical labour law : then and now / Ruth Dukes -- Social rights / Fernando Atria and Constanza Salgado -- Between persecution and reconciliation : criminal justice, legal form and human emancipation / Craig Reeves, Alan Norrie and Henrique Carvalho -- Facticity as validity : the misplaced revolutionary praxis of Europe / Michelle Everson and Christian Joerges -- Critical law and development / Fiona MacMillan -- International economic law's wreckage : depoliticization, inequality, precarity / Nicolàs M. Perrone and David Schneiderman -- Can transnational law be critical? : reflections on a contested idea, field and method / Peer Zumbansen -- International law / Bill Bowring -- Nihilists, pragmatists and peasants : a dispatch on contradiction in international human rights law / Margot E. Salomon.
